casebody.data:
Amy R. Sullivan, Appellee, v. John J. Sullivan, Appellant.Gen. No. 23,695. (Not to be reported in full.)Abstract of the Decision.Husband and wife, .§ 237*—when evidence warrants alloxoance in suit for separate maintenance. On a bill for separate maintenance, evidence held to support a ’decree awarding separate maintenance and requiring defendant to pay $10 a week for the support of the complainant and the child of the parties.Appeal from the Superior Court of Cook county; the Hon. Martin M. Gbidley, Judge, presiding.Heard in this court at the October term, 1917.Affirmed.Opinion filed March 5, 1918.

Statement of the Case.

Bill by Amy B. Sullivan, complainant, against John J. Sullivan, defendant, for support and maintenance of complainant and for the custody and maintenance of the child of the parties. From a decree awarding separate maintenance and requiring defendant to pay $10 a week for the support and maintenance of complainant and the child, defendant appeals.

McInerney & Power, for appellant.A. W. Glaskay, for appellee.

See Illinois Notes Digest, Vols. XI to XV, and Cumulative Quarterly, same topic and section number.

 Mr. Justice Dever

delivered the opinion of the court.
